qas.question: What did Humboldtian science aim to do?

answers.text: combining scientific field work with the age of Romanticism sensitivity, ethics and aesthetic ideals

qas.question: Who was the model for Humboldtian science?

answers.text: the only valid knowledge is scientific

context: Humboldtian science refers to the early 19th century approach of <a0_0>combining scientific field work with the age of Romanticism sensitivity, ethics and aesthetic ideals<a0_0/>. It helped to install natural history as a separate field, gave base for ecology and was based on the role model of scientist, naturalist and explorer <a1_0>Alexander von Humboldt<a1_0/>. The later 19th century positivism asserted that all authentic knowledge allows verification and that all authentic knowledge assumes that <a2_0>the only valid knowledge is scientific<a2_0/>.
